title: peerwallet
author: peerwallet
content: As there are multiple ways to get your crypto project to the public, but what are the recommended ways now adays?

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: peerwallet on September 19, 2023, 09:32:15 AMAs there are multiple ways to get your crypto project to the public, but what are the recommended ways now adays? In the forum, you can advertise in bounty or signature campaigns, where you can pay either with Bitcoin or with your campaign codes (almost for free), or a mixed payment between Bitcoin and your campaign codes, which is the cheapest and most secure method.You can try to advertise on X and Reddit, and I see some ads on YouTube, but I do not know that. You can also pay influencers to advertise for you on those sites.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: It depends on what exactly you want to advertise. But in general, I would say it's better not to focus on single method if you want to have bigger reach. Signature campaigns, banner ads, hire some influencers, make paid press releases on popular websites. How effective promotion results will be, it depends on your budget and how you will spend it. If you don't have good knowledge about marketing, then hire someone who is professional at these things.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Given the fact that there have been good suggestions already but remember that investors are going to invest on your project based on how interesting your project is. At first, they might be hype and will invest because of how good at marketing your are. In the long run, the stability of the project and the legimaticy of it on how the developers are working on it still have the final say. Don't get blinded with how good marketing is for a project when you're not working hard on the actuality of the project. Going with the marketing, as mentioned you start from the forum and spread it through other social medias if you've got budget.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Honest reviews campaign, because first it will definitely attract filtered early adopters (they wouldn't bother testing the platform if they weren't interested). Furthermore, these reviews will become a means of reference for many readers and some of them will become potential users if the review summary shows satisfaction.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: LTU_btc on September 19, 2023, 07:21:32 PMIt depends on what exactly you want to advertise. But in general, I would say it's better not to focus on single method if you want to have bigger reach. Signature campaigns, banner ads, hire some influencers, make paid press releases on popular websites. How long does the service last and the skill of the advertising team is what plays a role, as there are things that bring long-term clients, such as Signature campaigns, banner ads, and things that bring direct followers, such as hire some influencers, especially on YouTube, as the video rarely gets continuous views after several months. .Therefore, without a clear plan and the skill of the advertising team in controlling the budget to maintain the impact for the longest period with the least amount of payments is what determines the success of the project.Quote from: rat03gopoh on September 20, 2023, 03:36:21 PMHonest reviews campaign, because first it will definitely attract filtered early adopters (they wouldn't bother testing the platform if they weren't interested). Furthermore, these reviews will become a means of reference for many readers and some of them will become potential users if the review summary shows satisfaction.The reviews campaign is for the developing team and discovering defects in the system, not to create a brand or attract more customers. These reviews are also necessary for those who visit the service for the first time and want to make sure that everything is working.

comments.author: arwin100
comments.body: Quote from: peerwallet on September 19, 2023, 09:32:15 AMAs there are multiple ways to get your crypto project to the public, but what are the recommended ways now adays? Recruit famous social media influencers to promote your project. This is the fastest way to make it viral but it cost a lot since you need to pay expensive fees each video they created.But if you want to focus only in this forum signature campaign which has been suggested is one of the famous marketing options done by many business owners. But don't expect you get huge traffic instantly since it need to be done consistently so that you can get the long term result.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: peerwallet on September 19, 2023, 09:32:15 AMAs there are multiple ways to get your crypto project to the public, but what are the recommended ways now adays? Most already said, but I'll make an ordered list of what I think it matters the most:* review campaigns* allow - where possible - using your crypto project for free (for limited time, for limited amounts of money), so even those not in the review campaigns can take a look without paying* signature campaigns (awareness)* social media campaigns (I've seen this used mostly to create a short lived hype, but it's not always working)I will add that if you go with a presence on this forum, an official account (and ANNouncement) are pretty much mandatory, so people know where to turn in case of .. anything (it can do wonders in topics the support fails).

comments.author: CryptopreneurBrainboss
comments.body: Quote from: peerwallet on September 19, 2023, 09:32:15 AMAs there are multiple ways to get your crypto project to the public, but what are the recommended ways now adays? There are many ways and alot of them have been mentioned above but I just have to add using influencers to hype your project on YouTube, TikTok and twitter. Alot of users still listen to those guys and will buy anything they talk about. Getting them to hype your project will give the project some publicity and if your project has something different to offer from the rest of the projects in the market, you'll get yourself some loyal investors and you can start building from there. I won't recommend bounty right now because they don't bring in investors anymore as they use to since most participants uses fake account that don't get any genuine engagement but just bots. Their comments on the social media profile of projects they advertise looks spam like and might likely chase away potential investors that visit the social platforms instead of attracting them. Signature won't be the best option either because the exposure is limited to the forum. If your project is a gambling, mixer focused project that's when you'll get a lot of interest from the forum but anything altcoins should be taken to platforms that you'll get more results for the expenses you're going to make. You can also try media platforms that specialized in crypto related news as they get alot of engagement from cryptocurrency users. Getting an ad slots on this platforms will introduce your project to alot of crypto users.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Quote from: Quidat on September 29, 2023, 08:34:11 PM...exposure is always been that recommended.A short but very effective answer, it's exposure.  Now, use your common sense and you will do this, following the recommendation above might be a better option. But don't expect a better result in a short exposure, because running ads, a signature campaign or a review campaign might take months or years before it will effect.  So consistently having a long exposure to any campaign methods would be considered as an effective way.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: Quote from: peerwallet on September 19, 2023, 09:32:15 AMAs there are multiple ways to get your crypto project to the public, but what are the recommended ways now adays? Build a website for your project where potential adopters can find all the relevant informations about it. Then, launch social media and forum campaigns with clickable links following the same colour and style patterns of your project. Signature campaigns paying in BTC are more relevant than campaigns paying in stakes of your token at altcoins' section. You have to decide what you prefer: cheap advertisement in high scale hiring newbies, jr. members and so on... Or more expensive advertisement selecting only forum users with higher ranks.

comments.author: bhadz
comments.body: I reckon the honest campaign reviews, they're effective because you're asking for everyone's honest opinions about your project in return, you'll pay them for that. And despite you've paid the participants, it doesn't mean that you're going to get good reviews but that means, you're getting honest and real opinions about your project for you to have an idea on how to improve it and to get the way of thinking of the community that you're targeting. Avoid the social media influencers, you'll just get investors who are there for their short-term goals. Unless those are your target people but if you like the real investors that will believe in your project, stick to the honest ones without any hyping or misleading through any marketing means. You may have a good result at the beginning if that's your choice but the long term impact of it is going to get you dried.

comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: Quote from: peerwallet on September 19, 2023, 09:32:15 AMAs there are multiple ways to get your crypto project to the public, but what are the recommended ways now adays? The most obvious has to be the use of social media(facebook,x, tik tok etc)Other unexplored options has to be the use of ads on high-traffic websites like crypto news websites, block explorer websites, or ads on YouTube etcBut when it comes to tapping into the power of this forum, your options range from Signature campaigns, product reviews via beta testing or article reviews, bounty campaigns which is actually a big package of all kinds of social media marketing...Afaik ones budget will usually determine what options you can explore, but if you looking for a solution to get your project out there good luck hope you found something that will help from the suggestions given on this thread
